title: The Science of Cooking
description: Cooking food involves many processes that can change the shape, texture, and flavor of food. What are these processes and how do they work? The Science of Cooking gives students a detailed look at the chemical and physical changes that happen when food is prepared and cooked. The book can also be used to teach students how to determine cause-and-effect relationships and when and how to use commas in a series.
highFrequencyWords: caramelization, collide, complex, digests, distinct, efficiently, ingredients, Maillard reaction, molecules, nutrients, reversed, texture
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
